meanings.sent1: She only cleaned partway through the room before taking a break.
meanings.sent2: He always stops partway when running because he gets tired.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the tree but only made it partway up before giving up.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project waned partway through, and she lost interest.
meanings.sent5: The sun was only partway up in the sky, casting long shadows across the field.

meanings.definition: At or to a point part of the way along a route or journey
meanings.sent1: They stopped partway down the mountain to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent2: The bus broke down partway to the city, causing a delay.
meanings.sent3: The hikers decided to have a picnic partway up the hill.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a doctor was derailed partway through medical school.
meanings.sent5: The river was frozen solid partway across, making it impossible to continue.
